text: companies are putting more data into
their data lakes and are using open
source big data frameworks such as
apache spark presto hive and flink to
process this data that's why we built
amazon emr a managed service that makes
it easy to run petabyte-scale data
analytics in the cloud
with emr customers can provision
clusters of any size in minutes
emr automatically installs and
configures open source frameworks and
provides a performance optimized runtime
that is compatible with and over two
times faster than standard open source
emr customers have full control over the
configuration of their clusters and can
optimize them for performance and cost
based on their workload requirements
tuning clusters for optimal cost and
performance requires engineers to have
deep knowledge of the underlying
analytics frameworks however some
customers don't need this level of
customization and control and want a
simpler way to run open source
frameworks on emr
introducing amazon emr serverless a new
deployment option in emr that makes it
easy and cost effective to run
applications built using open source
frameworks such as apache spark hive and
presto without having to tune operate
secure optimize and manage clusters
using emr serverless is super easy
customers simply pick the open source
framework to use and run their
applications using apis cli aws
management console or with emr studio
emr serverless automatically provisions
and scales the compute and memory
resources required by applications and
customers only pay for the resources
they use
with emr serverless customers do not
have to worry about over or under
provisioning resources for their data
processing jobs
customers can check the status of
running jobs in emr studio or the aws
console review job history and use
familiar open source tools to debug jobs
emr server list is the simplest way for
customers to run applications built
using open source big data analytics
frameworks in the cloud try emr server
list today
